newsitem.title: JAPAN: Honda to buy majority stake in Indian venture.
newsitem.headline: Honda to buy majority stake in Indian venture.

text.p: Honda Motor Co Ltd said on Monday it would spend about 620 million rupees ($17.3 million) for a majority stake in its Indian joint venture Shriram Honda Power Equipment Ltd (SHPE).

Honda currently has a 33.33 percent stake in SHPE and the purchase of an additional 23.33 percent from its Indian partner Shriram Industrial Enterprises Ltd (SIEL) will boost its stake to 56.66 percent, a Honda spokesman said.
As a result of the sale, SIEL's stake in the joint venture will fall to 10 percent. Local investors hold the remaining shares in the venture, the spokesman said.

SHPE, which produces power generators and general-purpose engines and pumps, has a production capacity of 120,000 power generators a year, the spokesman said, adding that if has about 60 percent of the Indian power generator market.
The company will produce an estimated 90,000 power generators in calendar 1997, he added.
Honda has decided to take a majority stake in the Indian venture with the aim of strengthening its management and improving productivity, the Honda spokesman said.

The actual purchase of the stake is expected to take place in October, as it is expected to take about four months to obtain permission from the Indian government for the equity deal, the spokesman said.
